DataElement.preferredName: Arizona Tobacco Survey Smoked Pipe or Cigar at Least Twenty Times in Lifetime Tobacco Delivery Type
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A person's stated response about whether, if they smoked a pipe or cigar at least twenty times in their life, which delivery method was used.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Arizona Tobacco Survey Smoked Pipe or Cigar at Least Twenty Times in Lifetime
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A random, computerized, telephone survey of Arizona residents over 18 years old, conducted in 1996 and 1999, designed to track changes in tobacco use, the knowledge and opinions of Arizona residents about tobacco use, and the proportion of smokers advised to quit smoking by healthcare providers._A question about whether an individual has or had smoked a pipe or cigar at least twenty times in their lifetime.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A random, computerized, telephone survey of Arizona residents over 18 years old, conducted in 1996 and 1999, designed to track changes in tobacco use, the knowledge and opinions of Arizona residents about tobacco use, and the proportion of smokers advised to quit smoking by healthcare providers.

Concepts.definition: A random, computerized, telephone survey of Arizona residents over 18 years old, conducted in 1996 and 1999, designed to track changes in tobacco use, the knowledge and opinions of Arizona residents about tobacco use, and the proportion of smokers advised to quit smoking by healthcare providers.
